title.narrative: Empowering deprived youth on ICT in Bangladesh

description.narrative: Upskilling of deprived youth living the urban slums of Dhaka to acces decent jobs in the global freelance coding market.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: 1. Deprived young men and women (50/50), 17-25 years, living in the urban slums of Dhaka gain decent employment within the global freelance market (contributing directly to Global Goals 1 & 8). 2. Deprived young men and women (50/50), 17-25 years, living in the urban slums of Dhaka become active and accepted citizens (Contributing directly to SDG 8, and indirectly to SDG 1, 3 & 4). 3. The financial sustainability and scalability of the project is accelerated and improved through a revolving impact investment fund and e-learning platform (contributing directly to SDG 8, and indirectly to SDG 1, 3 & 4).

1. 4,000 deprived young men and women, 17-25 years, living in the urban slums of Dhaka are working as freelance coders, earning 3 times their current monthly pay ($+250/month) in safe working conditions by year 3 funded by the project. 2. Another 3,700 deprived young men and women, 17-25 years, living in the urban slums of Dhaka are working freelance coders, ultimately earning 3 times their current monthly pay ($+250/month) in safe working conditions by year 3 funded by the revolving impact fund. 3. A revolving impact fund is established to generate scale and impact in and beyond the 3-year project period. 4. Awareness about Responsible Business Conduct among corporate partners is promoted by the application of Children's Rights and Business Principles (CRBP) and the UN Guiding Principles. 5. A revolving impact fund is established to generate scale and impact beyond the 3-year project period.

target.value: 4,000 deprived young men and women, 17-25 years, living in the urban slums of Dhaka are working as freelance coders, earning a decent salary in safe working conditions. Another 3,700 deprived youth have foundational skills and vocational skills (coding) enabling them to enter the freelance job market by the end of the project.
